title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on 2 Corinthians chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of 2 Corinthians Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:1, what do we have if our earthly house is dissolved?
options: A building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: A building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:1 states that if our earthly house is dissolved, we have a building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

questions.question: What do we earnestly desire to be clothed upon with, according to 2 Corinthians 5:2?
options: Our house which is from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Our house which is from heaven
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:2 says we groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 5:4 says we groan because we want to be unclothed.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:4 clarifies that we groan not because we want to be unclothed, but clothed upon so that mortality might be swallowed up of life.

questions.question: Who has given us the earnest of the Spirit, according to 2 Corinthians 5:5?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:5 states that God who hath wrought us for the selfsame thing hath given us the earnest of the Spirit.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:7, how do we walk?
options: By the law, not by grace
questions.correctAnswer: By faith, not by sight
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:7 clearly states, 'For we walk by faith, not by sight.'

questions.question: What is Paul’s willingness concerning being absent from the body, according to 2 Corinthians 5:8?
options: To be present with the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: To be present with the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:8 says Paul is willing rather to be absent from the body and present with the Lord.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 5:10 teaches that everyone will appear before the judgment seat of Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:10 states that we must all appear before the judgment seat of Christ to receive according to our deeds.

questions.question: What does the love of Christ constrain us to do, according to 2 Corinthians 5:14?
options: To live not unto ourselves but unto Him who died for us
questions.correctAnswer: To live not unto ourselves but unto Him who died for us
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:14 teaches that the love of Christ constraineth us because He died for all, so we live unto Him who died and rose again.

questions.question: Complete this verse from 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'If any man be in Christ, he is a new ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: creature
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:17 states that if any man is in Christ, he is a new creature.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:18, who reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:18 says all things are of God, who reconciled us to Himself by Jesus Christ.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 5:20 describes believers as ambassadors for Christ.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:20 states that we are ambassadors for Christ, beseeching men to be reconciled to God.

questions.question: What was Christ made to be for us, according to 2 Corinthians 5:21?
options: Sin for us, who knew no sin
questions.correctAnswer: Sin for us, who knew no sin
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:21 explains that Christ was made to be sin for us, though He knew no sin.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:16, how do we now know Christ?
questions.correctAnswer: No more after the flesh
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:16 states that although we knew Christ after the flesh, now we know Him no more after the flesh.

questions.question: What ministry have we received from God according to 2 Corinthians 5:18?
questions.correctAnswer: The ministry of reconciliation
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:18 tells us that God hath given us the ministry of reconciliation.

questions.question: What do we persuade men with, as stated in 2 Corinthians 5:11?
options: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:11 says that knowing the terror of the Lord, we persuade men.

medium.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with the fear of death. Based on 2 Corinthians 5, what hope can you share about what awaits beyond this life?
options: We have a building of God, an eternal house not made with hands in heaven
We will immediately return to dust without hope
We will be reincarnated into another earthly body
We enter a state of unconscious sleep until resurrection
questions.correctAnswer: We have a building of God, an eternal house not made with hands in heaven
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:1 teaches that though our earthly body may be dissolved, we have an eternal house in heaven, offering hope beyond death, supported also by verses 2, 4, and 8.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 5 encourage believers to live, knowing they will appear before the judgment seat of Christ?
options: Labour to be accepted by God whether present or absent
Ignore earthly actions as only faith matters
Focus on pleasing people rather than God
questions.correctAnswer: Labour to be accepted by God whether present or absent
questions.explanation: Verse 9 instructs us to labor so that we may be accepted by God regardless of our earthly or heavenly presence, which aligns with the accountability described in verse 10 and the need for sincere living.

questions.question: A fellow Christian feels weak in faith because they cannot see God. What biblical principle from 2 Corinthians 5 can you share?
options: We walk by faith, not by sight
Faith is unnecessary if we cannot see God
We should only believe what we can physically verify
Seeing God is the only way to believe
questions.correctAnswer: We walk by faith, not by sight
questions.explanation: Verse 7 clearly states that believers walk by faith and not by sight, encouraging trust in God even without physical evidence, supported by verses 6 and 8 about confidence in being with the Lord.

questions.question: What motivates believers to persuade others according to 2 Corinthians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: The terror of the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 11 emphasizes that knowing the terror of the Lord motivates believers to persuade others, grounded in reverence and accountability before God, also relating to verse 10 about judgment.

questions.question: Based on 2 Corinthians 5, how should Christians view their old sinful nature after coming to faith in Christ?
options: As passed away and replaced with newness in Christ
As irrelevant to their current life
questions.correctAnswer: As passed away and replaced with newness in Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 17 states that any person in Christ is a new creature, with old things passed away and all things become new, highlighting transformation and renewal through faith.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 5 describe the ministry given to believers?
questions.correctAnswer: The ministry of reconciliation
questions.explanation: Verse 18 explains that God has reconciled us to Himself and given us the ministry of reconciliation, emphasizing our role in restoring relationships through the Gospel.

questions.question: If a believer is struggling with guilt over sin, what truth from 2 Corinthians 5 can bring them comfort?
options: God was in Christ, reconciling the world and not imputing their trespasses
They must earn forgiveness through works
They must confess repeatedly to other believers
questions.correctAnswer: God was in Christ, reconciling the world and not imputing their trespasses
questions.explanation: Verse 19 teaches that God, through Christ, reconciles the world by not imputing trespasses, offering grace and forgiveness that believers can rely on.

questions.question: What role do believers have as representatives of Christ, according to 2 Corinthians 5?
options: Ambassadors for Christ, beseeching others to be reconciled to God
questions.correctAnswer: Ambassadors for Christ, beseeching others to be reconciled to God
questions.explanation: Verse 20 describes believers as ambassadors for Christ who urge others to be reconciled to God, highlighting the responsibility to actively share the Gospel.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with selfishness. Based on 2 Corinthians 5, what should they remember about Christ's purpose in dying for them?
options: That they should no longer live for themselves but for Christ who died and rose again
That selfishness is acceptable since Christ died
That living for oneself is encouraged
That Christ's death was unrelated to personal living
questions.correctAnswer: That they should no longer live for themselves but for Christ who died and rose again
questions.explanation: Verse 15 teaches that Christ died for all so that those who live should live unto Him, guiding believers away from selfishness toward Christ-centered living.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 5 encourage believers to live in light of being clothed with the heavenly dwelling?
options: With earnest desire and groaning for the heavenly body that swallows up mortality
With indifference to their earthly life
questions.correctAnswer: With earnest desire and groaning for the heavenly body that swallows up mortality
questions.explanation: Verses 2-4 describe believers groaning and earnestly desiring to be clothed with the heavenly house, motivating holy living and hope beyond earthly mortality.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 5, believers are confident and willing to be absent from the body to be present with the Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 8 clearly states believers are confident and willing to be absent from the body and present with the Lord, reflecting assurance in eternal life.

questions.question: True or False: 2 Corinthians 5 teaches that knowing Christ after the flesh is the ultimate understanding of Him that believers should hold onto.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 16 says that although we may have known Christ after the flesh, now we know Him no more in that way, indicating a deeper, spiritual understanding is required.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'For he hath made him to be _____ for us, who knew no sin; that we might be made the righteousness of God in him.'
questions.correctAnswer: sin
questions.explanation: Verse 21 explains that Christ was made sin for us, though He knew no sin, so that we might be made the righteousness of God in Him, central to the doctrine of substitutionary atonement.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 5 describe the relationship between God's Spirit and believers in the context of their earthly and heavenly dwelling?
options: God has given us the earnest of the Spirit as a guarantee
The Spirit is withdrawn until after death
Believers must earn the Spirit by works
The Spirit only dwells in the earthly body
questions.correctAnswer: God has given us the earnest of the Spirit as a guarantee
questions.explanation: Verse 5 states that God has given the Spirit as an earnest, or guarantee, of the future heavenly dwelling, assuring believers of God's promises.

questions.question: A believer is dealing with criticism from those who value outward appearances. According to 2 Corinthians 5, how should they respond?
options: Focus on commendation in heart rather than appearance
Try to impress others with outward show
questions.correctAnswer: Focus on commendation in heart rather than appearance
questions.explanation: Verse 12 encourages believers not to commend themselves by appearance but to have sincere hearts, indicating integrity over external show.

hard.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from 2 Corinthians Chapter 5.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 5:1, Paul contrasts our earthly body with what kind of building?
options: A building of God, eternal in the heavens
questions.correctAnswer: A building of God, eternal in the heavens
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:1 contrasts the earthly tabernacle with a building of God, not made with hands, eternal in the heavens.

questions.question: What does Paul say believers groan for in 2 Corinthians 5:2?
options: To be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven
questions.correctAnswer: To be clothed upon with our house which is from heaven
questions.explanation: Verse 2 states believers groan, earnestly desiring to be clothed upon with our house from heaven, indicating longing for eternal dwelling.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:4, what do believers desire instead of being unclothed?
options: To be clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life
To be free from all burdens immediately
To return to their earthly body
To be alone with God without any body
questions.correctAnswer: To be clothed upon, that mortality might be swallowed up of life
questions.explanation: Verse 4 explains believers groan being burdened, not to be unclothed but clothed upon so mortality is swallowed up by life.

questions.question: Who is described as the one who hath wrought us for the selfsame thing and given the earnest of the Spirit in 2 Corinthians 5:5?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Verse 5 identifies God as the one who wrought us for this purpose and gave us the earnest of the Spirit.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 5:6, what two states does Paul mention about believers' presence in body and with the Lord?
options: At home in the body but absent from the Lord
Absent from the body but present with the Lord
Neither at home in the body nor with the Lord
Both at home in the body and present with the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: At home in the body but absent from the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord, indicating a tension between earthly life and spiritual presence.

questions.question: What is the meaning of the phrase 'we walk by faith, not by sight' in 2 Corinthians 5:7?
options: Believers live guided by trust in God rather than physical evidence
Believers rely on their own understanding
Believers reject all forms of knowledge
questions.correctAnswer: Believers live guided by trust in God rather than physical evidence
questions.explanation: Verse 7 emphasizes living by faith—trust in God’s promises—rather than relying solely on what is seen or experienced physically.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:10, before whom must all appear to receive recompense for deeds?
questions.correctAnswer: The judgment seat of Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states that all must appear before the judgment seat of Christ to receive according to their deeds done in the body.

questions.question: What is the primary motive for Paul's persuasion of men, as stated in 2 Corinthians 5:11?
options: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.explanation: Verse 11 reveals that awareness of the Lord’s terror motivates Paul to persuade men toward repentance and faith.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 5:14, what constrains Paul and his companions?
questions.correctAnswer: The love of Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 14 states that the love of Christ constrains believers, motivating their ministry and conduct.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from 2 Corinthians 5:17: 'Therefore if any man be in Christ, he is a ___; old things are passed away; behold, all things are become new.'
questions.correctAnswer: new creature
questions.explanation: Verse 17 declares that anyone in Christ becomes a new creature, with old things passing away and all becoming new.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:18, who reconciled us to Himself and gave us the ministry of reconciliation?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states that God reconciled us to Himself through Jesus Christ and gave us the ministry of reconciliation.

questions.question: What is the role of believers as described in 2 Corinthians 5:20?
questions.correctAnswer: Ambassadors for Christ
questions.explanation: Verse 20 calls believers ambassadors for Christ, beseeching others to be reconciled to God.

questions.question: Which theological concept is illustrated by 'he hath made him to be sin for us, who knew no sin' in 2 Corinthians 5:21?
questions.correctAnswer: Substitutionary atonement
questions.explanation: Verse 21 expresses the doctrine of substitutionary atonement, where Christ, sinless, became sin for us that we might be made righteous.

questions.question: True or False: According to 2 Corinthians 5:16, Paul continues to know Christ according to the flesh as before.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 16 states that though Paul knew Christ after the flesh, henceforth he knows Him no more in that way, emphasizing spiritual knowledge over physical.

questions.question: What is the ultimate purpose of those who live according to 2 Corinthians 5:15?
options: To live unto Him who died and rose again
questions.correctAnswer: To live unto Him who died and rose again
questions.explanation: Verse 15 teaches that those who have been redeemed no longer live for themselves but live for Christ who died and rose again.

theological.title: 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from 2 Corinthians Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:1, what does Paul say awaits believers after their earthly body is dissolved?
options: A building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens
A temporary resting place until resurrection
A return to dust without hope
questions.correctAnswer: A building of God, an house not made with hands, eternal in the heavens
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:1 states that if our earthly house is dissolved, we have a building from God, eternal in the heavens. This corresponds with promises in John 14:2-3 (Jesus preparing a place), Hebrews 11:16 (a heavenly city), and Revelation 21:2-3 (the new Jerusalem).

questions.question: What is the 'earnest of the Spirit' referred to in 2 Corinthians 5:5?
options: A guarantee or deposit given by God to believers
questions.correctAnswer: A guarantee or deposit given by God to believers
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:5 describes the Holy Spirit as the earnest, or deposit, God gives to believers, assuring their future inheritance. This concept is supported by Ephesians 1:13-14 (Spirit as seal), Romans 8:16, and 2 Timothy 1:14.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 5:7, Paul says, 'For we walk by faith, not by ___.' What is the missing word?
questions.correctAnswer: sight
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:7 explicitly says believers walk by faith, not by sight. This principle aligns with Hebrews 11:1 (faith is assurance), John 20:29 (blessed are those who believe without seeing), and Romans 8:24-25.

questions.question: What does Paul say is the motivation that 'constraineth us' in 2 Corinthians 5:14?
questions.correctAnswer: The love of Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:14 states that the love of Christ compels believers. This motivation is consistent with John 13:34 (command to love), Romans 5:8 (Christ's love demonstrated), and 1 John 4:19 (we love because He first loved us).

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:15, why did Christ die for all?
options: So that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for Him who died and rose again
To establish a new political kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: So that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for Him who died and rose again
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:15 teaches that Christ's death leads believers to live for Him, not themselves. This is consistent with Romans 6:11-13 (reckoning ourselves dead to sin), Galatians 2:20, and Philippians 1:21.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 5:17 say happens to a person who is 'in Christ'?
options: He is a new creature; old things are passed away and all things are become new
He remains the same but is forgiven
He must follow the law perfectly
He is temporarily cleansed until final judgment
questions.correctAnswer: He is a new creature; old things are passed away and all things are become new
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:17 describes new creation in Christ, consistent with Ezekiel 36:26 (new heart), Galatians 6:15, and Romans 6:4 (newness of life).

questions.question: What ministry does God give to believers according to 2 Corinthians 5:18?
questions.correctAnswer: The ministry of reconciliation
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:18 states that God has reconciled us to Himself and given us the ministry of reconciliation. This aligns with Isaiah 53 (reconciliation through the suffering servant), Romans 5:10-11, and Colossians 1:20-22.

questions.question: How does 2 Corinthians 5:19 describe God's work in Christ regarding the world?
options: Reconciled the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them
Judged the world according to their deeds
Punished the world for their sins
Left the world to its own devices
questions.correctAnswer: Reconciled the world unto himself, not imputing their trespasses unto them
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:19 reveals God's reconciling work in Christ, not counting people's sins against them. This is consistent with Isaiah 53:6, Romans 3:25, and Hebrews 9:28.

questions.question: In 2 Corinthians 5:20, what role do believers have as stated by Paul?
questions.correctAnswer: Ambassadors for Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:20 calls believers ambassadors for Christ, representing Him to the world. This role is supported by Matthew 28:19-20 (Great Commission), Ephesians 6:20, and 1 Peter 2:9.

questions.question: What does Paul say about Christ in 2 Corinthians 5:21?
options: He was made to be sin for us, who knew no sin
He sinned to teach us humility
He was a sinner like us
questions.correctAnswer: He was made to be sin for us, who knew no sin
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:21 teaches the substitutionary atonement of Christ, who was sinless but made sin for us. This doctrine is also found in Isaiah 53:4-6, 1 Peter 2:24, and Romans 8:3.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:10, before what must all appear to receive according to their deeds?
questions.correctAnswer: The judgment seat of Christ
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:10 states all must appear before Christ's judgment seat to receive according to their deeds. This is consistent with Romans 14:10, Revelation 20:11-13, and Matthew 25:31-46.

questions.question: What does Paul mean in 2 Corinthians 5:16 when he says, 'know we no man after the flesh'?
options: We no longer view people merely by worldly or fleshly standards
We only relate to spiritual beings
We focus solely on earthly achievements
questions.correctAnswer: We no longer view people merely by worldly or fleshly standards
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:16 explains believers see others through spiritual transformation, not just fleshly or worldly criteria. This aligns with John 4:24, Galatians 6:15, and Romans 12:2.

questions.question: What does 2 Corinthians 5:8 reveal about Paul's attitude toward death and being with the Lord?
options: He is willing to be absent from the body to be present with the Lord
He fears death and wants to prolong life
He is uncertain about the afterlife
He prefers earthly life to the spiritual realm
questions.correctAnswer: He is willing to be absent from the body to be present with the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:8 states Paul is confident and willing to leave the body to be with the Lord, reflecting Philippians 1:23 and Luke 23:43.

questions.question: What reason does Paul give in 2 Corinthians 5:11 for persuading men?
options: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing the terror of the Lord
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:11 says Paul persuades men because he knows the terror of the Lord, consistent with Hebrews 10:31 and Romans 11:22.

questions.question: According to 2 Corinthians 5:9, what is the goal of Paul's labor whether present or absent?
options: That he may be accepted of Him
questions.correctAnswer: That he may be accepted of Him
questions.explanation: 2 Corinthians 5:9 teaches Paul labors so that he may be accepted by God whether present or absent. This aligns with Colossians 3:23-24 and 1 Corinthians 9:27.
